p: Hence, the high bioactivity of the essential oils that were tested could be attributed to some of its major constituents such as citronella, linalool, and 1,8-cineole, monoterpens of high bioactivity [ 19, 79, 80]. High toxicity of some these compounds was reported against stored product insects such as the rice weevil Sitophilus oryzae and Rhyzopertha dominica [ 81] and Tribolium confusum, Stanmopoulos et al [ 19]. Boeke et al. [ 82], reported that the volatile oils of C. nardus caused most of the eggs not to develop into adult (abnormality in egg development to adult).
